t: Ecclesiastes 10
Dead*pn flies putrefy the perfumer’s ointment, And*ld cause it to give off a foul odor; So*ild does*i a little folly to one respected for wisdom and*i honor.
A*ld wise man’s heart is*i at his right hand, But*ld a fool’s heart at his left.
Even*ld when a fool walks along the way, He*ld lacks wisdom, And*ld he shows everyone that*i he is*i a fool.
If*ld the spirit of the ruler rises against you, Do*ld not leave your post; For*ld conciliation pacifies great offenses.
There*ln is an evil I have seen under the sun, As*ld an error proceeding from the ruler:
Folly*ld is set in great dignity, While*ld the rich sit in a lowly place.
I*ld have seen servants on horses, While*ld princes walk on the ground like servants.
He*ln who digs a pit will fall into it, And*ld whoever breaks through a wall will be bitten by a serpent.
He*ld who quarries stones may be hurt by them, And*ild he who splits wood may be endangered by it.
If*ld the ax is dull, And*ld one does not sharpen the edge, Then*ld he must use more strength; But*ld wisdom brings success.
A*ln serpent may bite when it*i is*i not charmed; The*ld babbler is no different.
The*ld words of a wise man’s mouth are*i gracious, But*ld the lips of a fool shall swallow him up;
The*ld words of his mouth begin with foolishness, And*ld the end of his talk is*i raving madness.
A*ld fool also multiplies words. No*ld man knows what is to be; Who*ld can tell him what will be after him?
The*ld labor of fools wearies them, For*ld they do not even know how to go to the city!
Woe*ln to you, O land, when your king is*i a child, And*ld your princes feast in the morning!
Blessed*ld are*i you, O land, when your king is*i the son of nobles, And*ld your princes feast at the proper time— For*ld strength and not for drunkenness!
Because*ld of laziness the building decays, And*ld through idleness of hands the house leaks.
A*ld feast is made for laughter, And*ld wine makes merry; But*ld money answers everything.
Do*ln not curse the king, even in your thought; Do*ld not curse the rich, even in your bedroom; For*ld a bird of the air may carry your voice, And*ld a bird in flight may tell the matter.
